main event: In Summer 1951, a civilian observer reported seeing a silver, oblong-shaped object in Gonzales, Texas, for approximately 3/4 to 1 minute.
interesting points: The object was reported to be reflecting sunlight and made no sound., The observer noted the object moved in an erratic manner, rising and falling., Witnesses stated the object was about the size of a full moon when observed., The object disappeared from view after 3/4 to 1 minute., The observer had clear weather conditions and good visibility during the sighting.
witness description: A civilian observer with previous knowledge of aircraft who stood outside to observe the object.
